subject: COLLS
description: Topic and credit hours as arranged between faculty and student. A copy of the proposal must be sent to the College Scholar Program at as_csp@cornell.edu.

subject: COLLS
description: COLLS 4990 is the first part of the year-long thesis course in the College Scholar Program. Students submit their completed proposals to as_csp@cornell.edu by the add deadline in their penultimate semester. COLLS 4990 is added to the students' schedules once the project proposed has been approved.
catalogComments: Each participant must submit brief proposal approved by honors committee. Upon successful of the first semester, students are awarded an R grade and become eligible to enroll in COLLS 4991 the following semester.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: Two approved College Scholar seminars.

subject: COLLS
description: COLLS 4991 is the second part of the year-long thesis course in the College Scholar Program. A full draft of the thesis is due to the student's committee by March 15 to allow ample time for feedback and revisions. All students enrolled in COLLS 4991 present their findings at an event in April (exact dates TBD).
catalogComments: Students who received an R in COLLS 4990 send a mid-year progress report to as_csp@cornell.edu by the first day of the semester. They are then enrolled in COLLS 4991.

subject: COLLS
description: COLLS 4990 is the first part of the year-long thesis course in the College Scholar Program. Students submit their completed proposals to as_csp@cornell.edu and to their honors thesis committee by the add deadline in their penultimate semester. COLLS 4990 is added to the students' schedules once the thesis proposed has been approved.
